creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk
text:
SVGConstants is widely used throughout Batik. It is an interface but only
defines constants. As per 'Effective Java' (J.Bloch) Item 17, it should
preferably be converted to a final class. The namespace of references to its
constants would then be immediately obvious.

This request also applies to CSSConstants, XMLConstants, WMFConstants,
SVGSyntax, LexicalUnits, ErrorConstants
creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk

text:
Created attachment 12606
Gzipped output from 'cvs -q diff -wb'
creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk

text:
The attachment I just posted is the cvs diffs arising from changing all Batik
sources so that this bug is implemented. The changes were made against the
latest HEAD from CVS. All the code compiles and appears to run correctly.

Sorry I got attachment 12605 wrong; please use 12606.

Rick :-)
creator: richard.beton@roke.co.uk

text:
Reassigning all open bugs to the development list.
Sorry for the mass mailing.
creator: deweese@apache.org
helder.magalhaes@gmail.com
text:
Does this issue still make sense? While revisiting this issue I felt like this is tightly related to bug 45949, where it is stated [1] that it would not be necessary. Does this apply but in a different scope or could/should it be marked as a duplicate (although slightly counter-intuitive) of bug 45949 which is better described?

Also, I was tempted to add the "PatchAvailable" keyword but, as the format is CVS based, in standard diff format [2] (which, at least for me, it's quite unfeasible to "parse" visually) and potentially outdated, I was wondering if the reporter was able to update it and/or someone with more expertize could jump in. :-)

[1] http://markmail.org/message/5l4ahy6q5uwf7zgl
[2] http://search.cpan.org/dist/SVN-Web/lib/SVN/Web/DiffParser.pm#DESCRIPTION
